title: What is the best name of any Music Album ever? - Quora

response.answer_text: Fear of a Blank Planet by the Porcupine Tree. The album cover has haunting vacuous blue eyes set in an equally daunting visage, lit by the omnipresent “blue light” that the album title references as an agent in the overall “blankness” precipitating in the youth. Their excessive attachment to the computer and television screens, indulgence in nihilistic pursuits will eventually ensue in a planet comprising metaphorically “blank” people, a premonition amply echoed in the tracks of the album and the appurtenant music videos. The album title is an apt one, rather than many outrageously named album titles to evoke shock or smirks or those which have no bearing whatsoever to the album content.  References: Image: Fear of a Blank Planet - WikipediaInterpretation of the album cover derived from Fear of a Blank Planet - Steven Wilson

My all-time favorite name of an album is “Live Dead”, by the Grateful Dead  Followed by “Who’s Next” by the Who. It has two meanings. First, it is the Who’s next album, second, looking at the cover, who is next to pee on the stone.  I would add “Ruber Soul”, by the Beatles  And “Blood on the Tracks”, by Bob Dylan  Honorable mentions, “Days of Future Past”, by the Moody Blues  And “Sticky Fingers” by the Rolling Stones
